verses.verse: (A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choir director; according to) (Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.) O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation, <S%H3444><s%> I have cried <S%H6817><s%> out by day <S%H3117><s%> and in the night <S%H3915><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> Thee.
Let my prayer <S%H8605><s%> come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Thee; Incline <S%H5186><s%> Thine ear <S%H241><s%> to my cry! <S%H7440><s%>
For my soul <S%H5315><s%> has had <S%H7646><s%> enough <S%H7646><s%> troubles, <S%H9567><s%> And my life <S%H9132><s%> has drawn <S%H5060><s%> near <S%H5060><s%> to Sheol. <S%H7585><s%>

I am reckoned <S%H2803><s%> among <S%H5973><s%> those who go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit; <S%H953><s%> I have <S%H1961><s%> become <S%H1961><s%> like a man <S%H1397><s%> without <S%H369><s%> strength, <S%H353><s%>

Forsaken <S%H2670><s%> among the dead, <S%H4191><s%> Like <S%H3644><s%> the slain <S%H2491><s%> who lie <S%H7901><s%> in the grave, <S%H6913><s%> Whom <S%H834><s%> Thou dost remember <S%H2142><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more, <S%H5750><s%> And they are cut <S%H1504><s%> off <S%H1504><s%> from Thy hand. <S%H3027><s%>
Thou hast put <S%H7896><s%> me in the lowest <S%H8482><s%> pit, <S%H953><s%> In dark <S%H4285><s%> places, <S%H4285><s%> in the depths. <S%H4688><s%>
Thy wrath <S%H2534><s%> has rested <S%H5564><s%> upon me, And Thou hast afflicted <S%H6031><s%> me with all <S%H3605><s%> Thy waves. <S%H4867><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

Thou hast removed <S%H7368><s%> my acquaintances <S%H3045><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from me; Thou hast made <S%H7896><s%> me an object <S%H8441><s%> of loathing <S%H8441><s%> to them; I am shut <S%H3607><s%> up and cannot <S%H3808><s%> go <S%H3318><s%> out.

My eye <S%H5869><s%> has wasted <S%H1669><s%> away <S%H1669><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of affliction; <S%H6040><s%> I have called <S%H7121><s%> upon Thee every <S%H3605><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> O Lord; <S%H3068><s%> I have spread <S%H7849><s%> out my hands <S%H3709><s%> to Thee.

Wilt Thou perform <S%H6213><s%> wonders <S%H6382><s%> for the dead <S%H4191><s%>? Will the departed <S%H7496><s%> spirits <S%H7496><s%> rise <S%H6965><s%> [and] praise <S%H3034><s%> Thee? Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Will Thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> be declared <S%H5608><s%> in the grave, <S%H6913><s%> Thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> in Abaddon <S%H11><s%>?
Will Thy wonders <S%H6382><s%> be made <S%H3045><s%> known <S%H3045><s%> in the darkness <S%H2822><s%>? And Thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of forgetfulness <S%H5388><s%>?
But I, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> have cried <S%H7768><s%> out to Thee for help, <S%H7768><s%> And in the morning <S%H1242><s%> my prayer <S%H8605><s%> comes <S%H6923><s%> before <S%H6923><s%> Thee.
O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> dost Thou reject <S%H2186><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>? [Why] dost Thou hide <S%H5641><s%> Thy face <S%H6440><s%> from me?
I was afflicted <S%H6041><s%> and about to die <S%H1478><s%> from my youth <S%H5290><s%> on; I suffer <S%H5375><s%> Thy terrors; <S%H367><s%> I am overcome. <S%H9023><s%>
Thy burning <S%H2740><s%> anger <S%H2740><s%> has passed <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> me; Thy terrors <S%H1161><s%> have destroyed <S%H6789><s%> me.
They have surrounded <S%H5437><s%> me like water <S%H4325><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> long; They have encompassed <S%H5362><s%> me altogether. <S%H3162><s%>
Thou hast removed <S%H7368><s%> lover <S%H157><s%> and friend <S%H7453><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from me; My acquaintances <S%H3045><s%> are [in] darkness. <S%H4285><s%>
